= Class *jplex.components.frame.FrameSet*  _extends [APIPangolincommonComponent jplex.common.Component]_  =

== Description ==
Creates a set of Frames.
This component is a kind of windows manager since it handles the
interaction between the different frames you've added.
<p>
Since Modal windows are `modal` (sic), it makes no sense to add a modal
frame to the frame set: a modal frame doesn't interact with any other frame, it is modal.
Even if there is no code-limitation about that, it leads to strange
behaviors sometimes. Just avoid it.

== Config Table ==
|| *Name* || *Default Value* || *Description* ||
|| _overlay_ || `false` ||  Show an overlay behind the whole frame set if `true` ||
|| _overlayColor_ || `"#000000" (black)` ||  Color of the overlay (only if `overlay` is `true`) ||
|| _overlayOpacity_ || `0.6` ||  Opacity of the overlay (only if `overlay` is `true`) ||

== Event Table ==
|| *Name* || *Description* || *Parameters* ||
|| _onAddFrameEvent_ ||  When a frame is added to the group ||   - `frame <jplex.components.Frame>`  the window that has been added <br/>  ||


== Methods ==                                
|| *Signature* || *Return Type* || *Description* ||
|| `add(Id)` || `jplex.components.Frame` || Add a new frame to the frame set. You can either supply a string to create<br/>a new component or an existing Frame component.<br/>The 'new' frame is extended and receives a new method (`toFront`) to handle<br/>the relative positioning between the frames of the set.<br />  - `Id <jplex.components.Frame|String>` of the new window to create,<br/>or Frame component to be added to the frame set.<br/>||
